title: Stour Valley Path Walking Route

images.title: Trevor Harris / Stour Valley Path at Kentwell Downs
images.caption: Stour Valley Path at Kentwell Downs. The footpath is, at this point, passing through a very large field of wheat towards the woodland of Pond Plantation.

images.title: Robert Edwards / Part of the Stour Valley Path at Flatford
images.caption: Part of the Stour Valley Path at Flatford where you will find Flatford Mill. This is the site of Constable's famous painting The Hay Wain.

images.title: Mike Smith / Stour Valley Path
images.caption: This shows the line of the path west of Dudsbury Rings, heading towards Longham.

images.title: David Anstiss / The Greensand Way and Stour Valley Path meet near Hothfield Common
images.caption: The Greensand Way and Stour Valley Path meet near Hothfield Common

images.title: Bob Jones / Stour Valley path
images.caption: Along the route of the former Sudbury to Bury St Edmunds railway line, which closed in 1961.

images.title: Robert Edwards / Part of the Stour Valley Path
images.caption: This section of the path is opposite Keddington parish church.

description: Follow the River Stour from Newmarket to Cattawade on this delightful walk through East Anglia. The walk passes through a series of pretty riverside towns and villages including Little Thurlow, Kedlington, Clare and the Clare Castle Country Park, Long Melford (with Melford Hall and Kentwell Hall ), Sudbury , Stoke By Nayland , Nayland and Dedham. You will also pass through the Dedham Vale AONB, an area which inspired much of the work of painter John Constable.
